page.title: 01Physical Features
page.content: The physical features have hardly changed since 1959.To the north east we have housing estates.Eastwards from the estates there is a gentle slope which ends in the flat flood plain of the{River Cuckmere}. Walking southwards from the estates we walk down a fairly steep slope.This slope ends at the area of cliffs known as {Seaford Head}.Going westwards along the footpath we come to{Hawk's Brow}.Here Seaford Head ends and the shingle beach begins.Parallel to the beach is the promenade.To the north of the promenade we have a built up area which becomes more dense as we walk in a northerly direction. Eventually we arrive at the Eastbourne Road.Here we are in the most thickly built up part of our area.
